snippet: The new owners of the Los Angeles Dodgers held their first news conference and were not eager to discuss their predecessor, Frank McCourt.
lead_paragraph: The new owners of the Los Angeles Dodgers had nearly escaped their first news conference on Wednesday without discussing their predecessor, Frank McCourt, when questions were asked about his continued role with the team: he still owns half the land surrounding Dodger Stadium, including the parking lots. After an increasingly unpopular reign as Dodgers' owner -- which culminated in a particularly nasty legal brawl over control of the team with Commissioner Bud Selig -- McCourt has become a bit like Harry Potter's archenemy, the evil Lord Voldemort: he who must not be named.

headline.main: Old Owner of Dodgers Not a Popular Topic With New Owners
